H7586.meaning: From שָׁאַל (shaal), ask. Saul = asked (of God). First king of Israel (1 Sam 9:2).
H7586.significance: Asked for by the people (1 Sam 8:5); rejected by the Lord (1 Sam 15:26). Name (asked) as the one given and then taken away—type of the king who did not obey.

H3083.meaning: From יָהּ (Yah) + נָתַן (natan), give. Jonathan = Yah has given. Son of Saul (1 Sam 14:1).
H3083.significance: Friend of David; covenant with him (1 Sam 18:3). Died with Saul at Gilboa (1 Sam 31:2). Name (Yah has given) as the gift of friendship—and the one who yielded the kingdom to David.

H3414.meaning: From רָם (ram), exalt, + יָהּ (Yah). Jeremiah = Yah exalts, or Yah loosens (womb). Prophet (Jer 1:1).
H3414.significance: Prophet of the fall of Jerusalem; weeping prophet (Jer 9:1). Name (Yah exalts) as the one who spoke the word of judgment—and of the new covenant (Jer 31:31).

H3168.meaning: From חָזַק (chazaq), strengthen, + אֵל (el), God. Ezekiel = God strengthens. Exile prophet (Ezek 1:3).
H3168.significance: Prophet of the glory and the dry bones (Ezek 37); watchman (Ezek 33:7). Name (God strengthens) as the one who spoke hope in exile.

H3124.meaning: From יוֹנָה (yonah), dove. Jonah = dove. Prophet (Jon 1:1).
H3124.significance: Sent to Nineveh; fled, swallowed, delivered (Jon 1–2). Name (dove) as the one who bore the word—and was cast out and restored. Type of death and resurrection (Matt 12:40).

H4318.meaning: From מִי (mi), who, + כָּמוֹ (kamo), like. Micah = who is like (Yah). Prophet (Mic 1:1).
H4318.significance: Prophet of Bethlehem (Mic 5:2); “who is like God?” (Mic 7:18). Name as the question that points to the one from Bethlehem.

H1035.meaning: Hebrew בֵּית לֶחֶם (Beth Lechem); house of bread. Bethlehem = house of bread. Town in Judah (Ruth 1:1; Matt 2:1).
H1035.significance: City of David; birthplace of Jesus (Matt 2:1; Luke 2:4). Mic 5:2: “from you shall come a ruler.” Name (house of bread) as the place of the Bread of Life.

G3478.meaning: Hebrew נָצְרַת (Natzrat); from נֵצֶר (netzer), branch, or place name. Nazareth = branch town. Town in Galilee (Matt 2:23).
G3478.significance: Where Jesus grew up (Luke 2:51); “can anything good come from Nazareth?” (John 1:46). Name (branch) as the place of the Branch (Isa 11:1)—the shoot from the stump.

G5376.meaning: Greek Φίλιππος (Philippos); from φίλος (philos), friend, + ἵππος (hippos), horse. Philip = lover of horses. Apostle (Matt 10:3); also the evangelist (Acts 8:5).
G5376.significance: Apostle; brought Nathanael to Jesus (John 1:43). Evangelist: baptized the Ethiopian (Acts 8:38). Name (lover of horses) as the one who ran to bring others to the King.

G4736.meaning: Greek Στέφανος (Stephanos); from στέφανος (stephanos), crown. Stephen = crown. Deacon (Acts 6:5).
G4736.significance: First martyr (Acts 7:59); “full of the Spirit” (Acts 6:5). Saw the Son of Man standing (Acts 7:56). Name (crown) as the one who received the crown of life (James 1:12).

G4609.meaning: Greek Σιλᾶς (Silas); from Latin Silvanus. Silas = forest. Companion of Paul (Acts 15:40).
G4609.significance: Prophet; sent with Paul and Barnabas (Acts 15:32). With Paul in prison at Philippi (Acts 16:25); sang and the doors opened. Name in the spread of the gospel.

H8352.meaning: From שִׁית (shit), set, appoint. Seth = appointed, substitute. Third son of Adam (Gen 4:25).
H8352.significance: Given in place of Abel (Gen 4:25); line of the promise (Gen 5:3). Name (appointed) as the seed appointed to carry the hope—type of the line that leads to the Seed.

H7259.meaning: From רָבַק (ravaq), tie, bind. Rebekah = binding, noose. Wife of Isaac (Gen 24:15).
H7259.significance: Chosen at the well (Gen 24:14); mother of Jacob and Esau. “Two nations in your womb” (Gen 25:23). Name (binding) as the one who bound the covenant to the chosen son.

H3812.meaning: From לָאָה (laah), weary. Leah = weary. Wife of Jacob (Gen 29:16).
H3812.significance: Unloved yet mother of six tribes (Gen 29:31); “Yah has seen my affliction” (Gen 29:32). Name (weary) as the one who bore the burden—and bore Judah, the line of the King.

H1683.meaning: From דְּבוֹרָה (devorah), bee. Deborah = bee. Prophetess and judge (Judg 4:4).
H1683.significance: Judged Israel; went with Barak to battle (Judg 4:9). “Mother in Israel” (Judg 5:7). Name (bee) as the one who brought the sting of judgment and the honey of deliverance.

H1439.meaning: From גָּדַע (gada), cut off. Gideon = hewer, cutter. Judge (Judg 6:11).
H1439.significance: Least in Manasseh (Judg 6:15); “the Lord is peace” (Judg 6:24). Fleece (Judg 6:36–40); 300 (Judg 7:7). Name (cutter) as the one who cut down the altar of Baal—and cut the army to 300.

H8123.meaning: From שֶׁמֶשׁ (shemesh), sun. Samson = sun man, or of the sun. Judge (Judg 13:24).
H8123.significance: Nazirite; strength in his hair (Judg 16:17). Betrayed by Delilah; died with the Philistines (Judg 16:30). Name (sun) as the one whose strength was the Lord’s—and whose fall was his own.

H4782.meaning: From מָרְדֳּכַי (Mordechai); possibly from Marduk (Babylonian god) or Hebrew “little man.” Mordecai = cousin of Esther (Est 2:5).
H4782.significance: Refused to bow to Haman (Est 3:2); “for such a time as this” (Est 4:14). Exalted under Xerxes (Est 8:2). Name in the deliverance of the Jews in Persia.

H5281.meaning: From נֹעַם (noam), pleasantness. Naomi = my pleasantness. Mother-in-law of Ruth (Ruth 1:2).
H5281.significance: “Call me Mara [bitter], for the Almighty has dealt bitterly with me” (Ruth 1:20). Returned with Ruth; Boaz became kinsman-redeemer. Name (pleasant) vs. grief—yet redemption at the end.

H1162.meaning: From בֹּעַז (Boaz); possibly “in him is strength.” Boaz = kinsman (Ruth 2:1).
H1162.significance: Redeemed Ruth and the land (Ruth 4:9–10); in the line of David (Ruth 4:21–22). Type of the kinsman-redeemer—strength in him to redeem. Name in the line of Christ.

G4826.meaning: Greek Συμεών (Simeon); from Hebrew שִׁמְעוֹן (Shimon), heard. Simeon = heard. Righteous man in the temple (Luke 2:25).
G4826.significance: Took the infant Jesus in his arms (Luke 2:28); “now you are letting your servant depart in peace” (Luke 2:29). Name (heard) as the one who heard the promise—and saw the Consolation.

H3878.meaning: From לָוָה (lavah), join, attach. Levi = joined. Third son of Jacob (Gen 29:34).
H3878.significance: Tribe of the priesthood; “now my husband will be joined to me” (Gen 29:34). Scattered in Israel (Gen 49:7); yet the Levites are joined to the Lord (Num 18:2).

H1144.meaning: From בֶּן (ben), son, + יָמִין (yamin), right hand. Benjamin = son of the right hand. Youngest son of Jacob (Gen 35:18).
H1144.significance: Born to Rachel in death (Gen 35:18); “son of my sorrow” / “son of the right hand.” Tribe of Saul and Paul. Name (right hand) as the beloved of the father.

G3530.meaning: Greek Νικόδημος (Nikodemos); from νίκη (nike), victory, + δῆμος (demos), people. Nicodemus = victory of the people. Pharisee (John 3:1).
G3530.significance: Came by night (John 3:2); “how can a man be born again?” (John 3:4). Brought myrrh and aloes for Jesus’ burial (John 19:39). Name (victory of the people) as the one who came to the true Victory.

G4091.meaning: Latin Pilatus; from pilum, javelin. Pilate = armed. Governor of Judea (Matt 27:2).
G4091.significance: Asked “What is truth?” (John 18:38); washed his hands (Matt 27:24). Delivered Jesus to be crucified. Name (armed) as the one with power—who could not see the truth.

H4714.meaning: Hebrew מִצְרַיִם (Mitzrayim); dual of מָצוֹר (matzor), siege. Egypt = the two straits (or land of bondage).
H4714.significance: House of slavery (Ex 20:2); place of sojourn and exodus. “Out of Egypt I called my son” (Hos 11:1; Matt 2:15). Type of the world and of deliverance.

H5514.meaning: Hebrew סִינַי (Sinai); from סְנֶה (seneh), thorn bush. Sinai = mountain of the thorn bush. Mountain of the law (Ex 19:1).
H5514.significance: Where the Lord gave the law (Ex 20); where Moses saw the glory. “The law was given through Moses” (John 1:17). Name as the place of covenant and theophany.

H5986.meaning: From עָמַס (amas), load, carry. Amos = burden. Prophet (Amos 1:1).
H5986.significance: Shepherd of Tekoa (Amos 1:1); “the Lord roars from Zion” (Amos 1:2). Name (burden) as the one who bore the burden of the word—judgment and the hope of the booth (Amos 9:11).

H1954.meaning: From יָשַׁע (yasha), save. Hosea = salvation. Prophet (Hos 1:1).
H1954.significance: Married Gomer as a sign (Hos 1:2); “name him Lo-ammi [not my people]” (Hos 1:9). Yet “in the place where it was said Not my people, it shall be said Sons of the living God” (Hos 1:10; Rom 9:26). Name (salvation) as the prophet of the covenant and the bride.

H5662.meaning: From עָבַד (avad), serve, + יָהּ (Yah). Obadiah = servant of Yah. Prophet (Obad 1:1).
H5662.significance: Vision concerning Edom (Obad 1:1); “the day of the Lord is near” (Obad 1:15). Name (servant of Yah) as the one who spoke judgment on the brother who did not serve.

H5151.meaning: From נָחַם (nacham), comfort. Nahum = comfort. Prophet (Nah 1:1).
H5151.significance: Vision concerning Nineveh (Nah 1:1); “the Lord is slow to anger” (Nah 1:3). Name (comfort) as the one who spoke comfort to Judah—and judgment to the oppressor.

H2265.meaning: From חָבַק (chavaq), embrace. Habakkuk = embrace. Prophet (Hab 1:1).
H2265.significance: “Why do you make me see iniquity?” (Hab 1:3); “the righteous shall live by his faith” (Hab 2:4; Rom 1:17). Name (embrace) as the one who clung to the word in the midst of judgment.

H6846.meaning: From צָפַן (tsaphan), hide. Zephaniah = Yah has hidden. Prophet (Zeph 1:1).
H6846.significance: “The day of the Lord is near” (Zeph 1:7); “seek the Lord, all you humble” (Zeph 2:3). Name (Yah has hidden) as the one who spoke of the remnant hidden in the day of wrath.

H2292.meaning: From חָג (chag), feast. Haggai = festive. Prophet (Hag 1:1).
H2292.significance: “Consider your ways” (Hag 1:5); “the latter glory of this house shall be greater than the former” (Hag 2:9). Name (festive) as the one who called the people to rebuild and to hope.

H2148.meaning: From זָכַר (zachar), remember, + יָהּ (Yah). Zechariah = Yah has remembered. Prophet (Zech 1:1).
H2148.significance: Visions of the lampstand and the Branch (Zech 3–4); “behold, your king is coming” (Zech 9:9). Name (Yah has remembered) as the prophet of the covenant and the coming King.

H4401.meaning: From מַלְאָכִי (Malachi), my messenger. Malachi = my messenger. Prophet (Mal 1:1).
H4401.significance: Last of the Twelve; “behold, I send my messenger” (Mal 3:1). “Elijah” before the great day (Mal 4:5). Name (my messenger) as the one who points to the Messenger of the covenant.

G0301.meaning: Greek Ἄμως (Amos); from Hebrew Amos. Amos = burden. Prophet (Luke 3:25).
G0301.significance: In the genealogy of Jesus (Luke 3:25). Name (burden) in the line that leads to the one who bore the burden of the world.

G1648.meaning: Greek Ἐλεάζαρ (Eleazar); from Hebrew אֶלְעָזָר (Elazar), God has helped. Eleazar = God has helped. In genealogy (Matt 1:15).
G1648.significance: In the line of Jesus (Matt 1:15). Name (God has helped) as the line that leads to the one who is our help.

G0918.meaning: Greek Βαρθολομαῖος (Bartholomaios); from Aramaic bar + Ptolemy. Bartholomew = son of Ptolemy. Apostle (Matt 10:3).
G0918.significance: One of the Twelve; often identified with Nathanael (John 1:45). Name (son of Ptolemy) in the circle of the apostles.

G0924.meaning: Greek Βαρτιμαῖος (Bartimaios); from Aramaic bar + Timaeus. Bartimaeus = son of Timaeus. Blind beggar (Mark 10:46).
G0924.significance: “Son of David, have mercy on me” (Mark 10:48); received his sight (Mark 10:52). Name (son of Timaeus/honor) as the one who received honor from the Son of David.

G0184.meaning: Aramaic חֲקַל דְּמָא (chaqal dema), field of blood. Akeldama = field of blood (Acts 1:19).
G0184.significance: Purchased with Judas’s silver (Matt 27:7–8; Acts 1:18–19). Name (field of blood) as the place of the betrayer’s end—and the price of innocent blood.

G0964.meaning: Hebrew בֵּית חֶסְדָּא (Beth Chesda); house of mercy. Bethesda = house of mercy. Pool in Jerusalem (John 5:2).
G0964.significance: Where the invalid was healed (John 5:8); “rise, take up your bed” (John 5:8). Name (house of mercy) as the place where the mercy of the Sabbath-healer was shown.

G0966.meaning: Hebrew בֵּית צַיְדָא (Beth Saida); house of fishing. Bethsaida = house of fishing. Town on the Sea of Galilee (Matt 11:21).
G0966.significance: Home of Philip, Andrew, Peter (John 1:44). Woes against it (Luke 10:13). Name (house of fishing) as the place of the fishers of men—and of unrepentance.

G1082.meaning: Hebrew כִּנֶּרֶת (Kinneret); harp. Gennesaret = region around the Sea of Galilee (Matt 14:34).
G1082.significance: Where Jesus landed after walking on the sea (Matt 14:34); many healed there (Matt 14:36). Name (harp) as the place of the music of healing.

G0116.meaning: Greek Ἀθῆναι (Athenai); from Athena. Athens = city of Athena. Capital of Attica (Acts 17:15).
G0116.significance: Where Paul disputed on the Areopagus (Acts 17:22); “unknown god” (Acts 17:23). Name as the place of philosophy—and the proclamation of the true God.

G0697.meaning: Greek Ἄρειος Πάγος (Areios Pagos); hill of Ares. Areopagus = Mars Hill (Acts 17:19).
G0697.significance: Where Paul stood and declared the unknown God (Acts 17:23–31). Name (hill of Ares) as the place of the world’s wisdom—and the wisdom of the cross.

G2265.meaning: Greek Ἡρωδιανοί (Herodianoi); partisans of Herod. Herodian = supporter of Herod (Mark 3:6).
G2265.significance: With Pharisees, sought to destroy Jesus (Mark 3:6). Tried to entangle him over tribute (Mark 12:13). Name as the world’s alliance against the King.

G2266.meaning: Greek Ἡρωδιάς (Herodias); from Herod. Herodias = wife of Herod Antipas (Matt 14:3).
G2266.significance: Had John the Baptist beheaded (Mark 6:24–28). Name (from Herod) as the one who used the world’s power to silence the voice.

G2333.meaning: Greek Θευδᾶς (Theudas); from θεός (theos), God, + δίδωμι (didomi), give. Theudas = God-given. Rebel (Acts 5:36).
G2333.significance: Mentioned by Gamaliel (Acts 5:36); “rose up, claiming to be somebody.” Name (God-given) as the one who was not—contrast with the true God-given King.

G2387.meaning: Greek Ἰαμβρῆς (Iambres); Egyptian name. Jambres = one of Pharaoh’s magicians (2 Tim 3:8).
G2387.significance: With Jannes, opposed Moses (2 Tim 3:8). “Foolish and unfit for the faith.” Name as the type of the opposition that cannot stand before the truth.

G2389.meaning: Greek Ἰαννῆς (Iannes); Egyptian name. Jannes = one of Pharaoh’s magicians (2 Tim 3:8).
G2389.significance: With Jambres, opposed Moses (2 Tim 3:8). Name as the type of the wisdom of the world—which is folly before the word of God.
